result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis Lee Minier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant at the discretion of probation obtain his GED/HSED or high school diploma through the Medford adult diplomacy program.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections.   If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis Lee Minier

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Travis Lee Minier in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of no contest to count 1.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court orders withheld sentence probation for one year; court costs; DNA SC; AODA and follow through with any recommendations; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; obtain his GED; HSED or high school diploma through the Medford Adult diplomacy program at agent's discretion.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Travis Lee Minier in court with attorney Alec Nocco .  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.  - rt

Defendant Travis Lee Minier in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $500.00 signature bond; booking and no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court orders a $500.00 signature bond; booking and no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  If a valid prescription to take only amounts prescribed to him at the dosage and time prescribed.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Next court date is April 7, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  Court orders Attorney Tlusty to file the complaint within five business days.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances unless he has a prescription and to take only the amounts prescribed to him at the dosage and time prescribed to take the medication.
